medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
provenance: Ernest Fenollosa, sold to Louisa Langdon Kane, after her passing Sybil Kent Kane (1856-1946) gave it to Louis V. Ledoux (1895'-1948); Roland Koscherak (around 1948); Richard P. Gale (until 1974)
text: Calender print of the year Meiwa 2 (1765) with the numbers for the long months on the woman's sleeves and the ones for the short months on the man's undergarment.
title: Visual Parody of the Noh Play "Takasago"
